TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to us.
Before we can proceed further with the case, can you please provide us the following information:
•        What is the impact of the issue on your business?
•        Who is affected by this issue?
•        What are the steps to reproduce? (please describe here as detailed as possible so that we can recreate it on our side)
•        Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried?
•        What are you trying to do or accomplish?
•        When did this issue start?
•       Screen shots, logs, other artifacts, etc.

Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000NYFSP:ref

Hi ,

Please find the required details below -

*        What is the impact of the issue on your business?
File upload is not getting blocked properly as per the CAP ( Block & Report ) Policy
*        Who is affected by this issue?
Windows Devices

*        What are the steps to reproduce? (please describe here as detailed as possible so that we can recreate it on our side)
-
*        Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried?

Ensured that DPI enabled in Global Settings.
Checked DPI is enabled for Edge and Chrome Web browser.
Checked Allowlists URLs if anything is added.
Configured duplicate policy. After that file upload is blocked as per the duplicate policy. But the original policy is not blocking the file uploading.

*        What are you trying to do or accomplish?
We need to block the all the file types to all the domains except allowed list URL's
*        When did this issue start?
Last week Friday.

*       Screen shots, logs, other artifacts, etc.
No.

Please connect over the remote session and resolve this issue as soon as possible.

Thanks & Regards,

Vinay Kumar

Hello,

Thank you for your reply.
As you mentioned, "Configured duplicate policy. After that file upload is blocked as per the duplicate policy. But the original policy is not blocking the file uploading.", can you please then use the duplicated policy instead?
From what you are describing, it seems that something did not save right at that moment for the first policy.

Best regards,
Alin Anca

Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to us.
Before we can proceed further with the case, can you please provide us the following information:
*        What is the impact of the issue on your business?
*        Who is affected by this issue?
*        What are the steps to reproduce? (please describe here as detailed as possible so that we can recreate it on our side)
*        Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried?
*        What are you trying to do or accomplish?
*        When did this issue start?
*       Screen shots, logs, other artifacts, etc.

Best regards,

Hi Marian,

We have observed below issues w.r.t CAP policy:


  1.  Data uploading on MS Office form is getting blocked even though we have whitelisted the URL.
  2.  When DPI is enabled, team is not able to take remote of the device from their ticketing tool(manage engine).
  3.  Some of the devices are showing offline even though it is connected to internet.

Request you to please schedule a call with us to troubleshoot the issues

Feel free to reach out again.

TextBody:
Hello Ram,

Sure, to recap what we've done today:

1.For the MS Forms issue, we adjusted the DPI allowlist and add it to the CAP policy to exclude the MS Form portal from being scanned when uploading documents.

2. For ManageEngine issue, Vinay already had a DPI allowlist in place, only thing to do was to have it added to the CAP policy to be excluded and as a result, it was working accordingl with both remote sessions issue and ticketing update problem.

3. For OneDrive, other than enabling the DPI, nothing else was done as the other settings were properly adjusted to allow accessing the files.

For the issue with the USB Device access we will check tomorrow at the specified timeframe.

Thank you for your patience!

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.netwrix.com

TextBody:
Hello Vinay,

Thank you for allowing us to assist you today.

To recap what we've done today:

We allowed the yealink wireless presentation pods  to be excluded from the device control by creating an exception rule for them.

We first tested on your 0051 machine and once we saw that it is working we added the rule to the global settings and tested on Ramesh's side and he confirmed it's working as well.

The current ticket will be marked as closed but if you have further issues/requests, do not hesitate to contact us.

Have a great day!

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.netwrix.com
